Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include different types of plants in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include different types of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show comparisons between the land and water habitats by including the different types of living things found in each.
The student can illustrate patterns in how different plants and animals are found in different habitats.
